intro: Waldheimia stracheyana, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and alpine habitats.
